alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Bullock; Pike (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 4:12PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Pike, south central Bullock and southwestern Barbour Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 412 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Banks, or 7 miles northeast of Brundidge, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Troy, Brundidge, Clio, Clayton, Louisville, Banks, Tyler Crossroads, Antioch, Texasville, Boot Hill, Tanyard, Millers Ford, Clayton Municipal Airport, Monticello, Josie, Sandfield and Brundidge Municipal Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
